page.title: 04ENERGY-GAS-THE FIELD
page.content: All the platforms will be linked to one another and to the shore by computer and telephones. { {THE MARINE PIPELINE The gas will travel to the shore through an under sea pipeline-about 40 kilometres in length and 900 mm in diameter.The pipeline route goes first to the Isle of Walney and then across Walney Channel to the terminal at Rampside,south of Barrow-in -Furness. The location of the terminal and route of the pipeline were not finalized until after the detailed study of the seabed.This showed that it would not be possible to lay the pipeline in the area of Morecambe Bay because of shifting sands.The pipe is laid from a ship called a laybarge.
